page.title: 02SHOPS,TRANSPORT
page.content: There is a shop and a public house in each village.The shop in Charlton Adam is a general food store and also a sub Post-Office.One may obtain food,greengrocery,some clothes and footwear,sweets,ice-cream:the shop is also licensed for the sale of beer and spirits. The shop in Charlton Mackrell is a food and general store but they are responsible for the sale and delivery of newspapers in both villages. There is no public transport of any significance.The railway station (G.W.R.) was closed in 1962 and a bus service begun then ran for only a short time.Nowadays there is a shopping bus to and from STREET on Fridays only,and a bus to and from YEOVIL also on Fridays.
